paragraphs.text:
%md # Our Training Courses Splice Machine offers automated training classes using interactive Apache Zeppelin notebooks. Before starting any of these classes, we recommend reading our [Splice Machine Basics](/#/notebook/2DX2STBE7), which requires only about 20 minutes of your time. And if you're new to using Zeppelin, our Zeppelin Notebook Basics notebook is a brief introduction to running and creating/modifying Zeppelin notebooks, which you'll need to understand to complete any class. We have four different training classes, each with its own curriculum folder:
Class Target Audience Prerequisites Time to Complete
Splice Machine Developers, Part I Query writers, ETL processors, developers Experience with SQL and some programming experience with Python or Scala 1-2 hours
Splice Machine Developers, Part II Query writers, ETL processors, developers Completion of Splice Machine Developers, Part I 2-3 hours
Data Science with Splice Machine Data Engineers and Data Scientists Experience with SQL, and some programming experience with Python or Scala. You should also have experience with implementing Machine Learning, data transformation, data analysis, streaming, model design and selection, and results interpretation. 2-3 hours
Splice Machine for DBAs DBAs and Application Support Specialists Experience with databases. 2-3 hours

msg.data:
Our Training Courses

Splice Machine offers automated training classes using interactive Apache Zeppelin notebooks. Before starting any of these classes, we recommend reading our Splice Machine Basics, which requires only about 20 minutes of your time.

And if you’re new to using Zeppelin, our Zeppelin Notebook Basics notebook is a brief introduction to running and creating/modifying Zeppelin notebooks, which you’ll need to understand to complete any class.

We have four different training classes, each with its own curriculum folder:

Class Target Audience Prerequisites Time to Complete
Splice Machine Developers, Part I Query writers, ETL processors, developers Experience with SQL and some programming experience with Python or Scala 1-2 hours
Splice Machine Developers, Part II Query writers, ETL processors, developers Completion of Splice Machine Developers, Part I 2-3 hours
Data Science with Splice Machine Data Engineers and Data Scientists Experience with SQL, and some programming experience with Python or Scala. You should also have experience with implementing Machine Learning, data transformation, data analysis, streaming, model design and selection, and results interpretation. 2-3 hours
Splice Machine for DBAs DBAs and Application Support Specialists Experience with databases. 2-3 hours
